result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] and Operating w/ PAC (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Scott T Keuter was found guilty of OWI (2nd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (2nd Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Scott T Keuter was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $650 fine plus costs. Cash bond applied. 60 days to pay fine/costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office.
10 days stayed upon attendance at VIP.  Huber release and good time granted. 60 days to report.
Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.

Obtain alcohol assessment through Door County Human Services and comply with treatment recommendations.  Must attend the Door/Kewaunee Victim Impact Panel session scheduled for 2/11/16 at the Justice Center.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott T Keuter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Scott T Keuter in court with attorney Mark Douglas Skvara.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 3. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 3. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Defendant Scott T Keuter in court with attorney Mark D. Skvara.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Skvara indicates defendant has some counseling sessions to finish before entering a plea, requests a plea/sentencing date in early January. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Scott T Keuter in court with attorney Mark D. Skvara.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:45 am.
from Atty Skvara asking to reschedule IA to 9/10/15 when he'll be in court with defendant on another matter. Court reschedules.
Defendant was fingerprinted 7/16/15 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 1/12/16)
